title: Senator Donna Campbell's Abortion Travel Ban Gets Texas Right to Life Endorsement
summary: Texas Right to Life PAC endorsed Lt. Governor Dan Patrick, highlighting Senator Donna Campbell's (R-New Braunfels) SB 33 that prevents cities from using taxpayer dollars to fund abortion travel. The bill directly targets efforts by local governments like Austin and San Antonio to subsidize out-of-state abortion trips.

title: Local Property Owners May Face Higher Tax Bills Under Proposed County Budget
summary: Comal County commissioners are reviewing a proposed budget that would increase property tax rates by 3.2% to fund critical infrastructure projects including road improvements and emergency services expansion. The current tax rate of 30.5 cents per $100 valuation was increased 15.4% in 2026 from the previous no-new-revenue rate. The proposal comes as the county experiences rapid population growth requiring upgraded public services.

title: TCEQ Public Hearing on Broken Cedar Ranch Draws 500 Concerned Residents
summary: Residents expressed dismay at TCEQ's handling of the February 10 public hearing for Lennar's 850-home Broken Cedar Ranch development near Fischer. County judge candidate Kristen Hoyt criticized the statewide bureaucratic system, saying damage from development is 'permanent, expensive and often universal.' Commissioner Doug Leecock said TCEQ and Lennar heard a 'resounding no' from the community regarding the 600,000 gallon-per-day wastewater discharge into Canyon Lake.

title: New Braunfels Pay-to-Park System Faces Backlash Despite $300K Revenue
summary: New Braunfels' downtown pay-to-park system has generated approximately $300,000 in six months but faces significant pushback from residents and business owners who report it's driving customers away. City Council will discuss potential updates later this month.

title: New Braunfels and Comal County to Share Emergency Operations Space
summary: New Braunfels will partner with Comal County to share emergency operations facilities, improving coordination and resource efficiency for disaster response and emergency management.

title: Comal County Appoints Interim Justice of Peace for Precinct 3
summary: Comal County commissioners appointed Mark Long as interim judge to fulfill the unexpired term for justice of the peace in Precinct 3, filling a judicial vacancy.

title: City Council Approves TIRZ Board Appointments
summary: New Braunfels City Council approved appointments to River Mill, Zipp Park, and West End TIRZ boards. Terms expire November 2027, except for Kyle Coker, Skylar Duran, and Patrick Wiggins whose terms expire in 2026.

title: New Braunfels Approves .2M Fire Training Facility Investment
summary: The city has allocated .2 million for a new fire training facility to boost firefighter readiness and response capabilities as the community continues to grow.

title: New Braunfels ISD Rejects State Prayer Time Requirement
summary: The NBISD Board of Trustees unanimously voted to decline adopting Senate Bill 11's required daily prayer and religious reading period, citing parental autonomy and existing religious expression rights.

title: New Braunfels City Council Approves Annexation of 200 Acres
summary: City Council voted 5-2 to annex approximately 200 acres along FM 306 for future mixed-use development. Council members Edwards and Spradley voted against, citing infrastructure concerns.
